Date: 2025-01-22 02:53
Subject: Insurance Claim Submission – Incident at Jacquemus Boutique (03/12/2024) - Allied Enterprises LLC
--------------------------------------------------
Dear Yogesh,

 

I hope this message finds you well. 

 

With reference to the liability insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, kindly note that incident occurred on 03/12/2024 at the Jacquemus boutique, Dubai Mall. Below, please find the key details and accompanying documentation:

 

Incident Description:

 

*	On 03/12/2024, our VIP client accidentally struck her Hermes ballet flats (slippers) against a damaged corner of the boutique’s fitting room. The affected area had exposed steel protrusions, which constituted an unsafe condition.
*	As a result, the ballet flats were damaged, and the client is requesting reimbursement.

 

Client Details and Purchase History:

 

*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\C31NMI7 - insurance claim submission – incident at jacquemus boutique (03 12 2024) - allied enterprises llc\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

 

*	Store Manager’s View: The store manager initially indicated that the damage appeared more related to customer-driven actions; however, store personnel later acknowledged there was exposed steel in the fitting room corner, which the client alleges caused the damage.
*	Safety Concern: The incident is without a doubt attributed to a hazardous condition in the fitting room, namely a protruding metal edge. (seen next to the damaged Hermes slipper in the attached photo)
*	The Group Security Control Room (GSCR) has provided CCTV footage of the incident. You may access it by following this link:   Footage <https://mctfze-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/hagop_ghazarian_chalhoub_com/Et7yhWGoozNJmGoEvI36-3YByWWt2PMMyj-GMs00s0X0AA?e=3XTsbM> 
*	Reimbursement Request: The client seeks reimbursement in cash for their damaged Hermes ballet flats, priced at AED 3,900, to purchase a replacement pair.
*	Supporting Attachments:

	*	Official invoice of the Hermes ballet flats (AED 3,900).
	*	Photos showing both the fitting room’s damaged edge (protruding sharp metal edge) and the client’s resulting damaged ballet flats.
	*	Whatsapp conversation with client requesting as cash reimbursement for the damages
	*	CCTV footage of the incident.  Footage <https://mctfze-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/hagop_ghazarian_chalhoub_com/Et7yhWGoozNJmGoEvI36-3YByWWt2PMMyj-GMs00s0X0AA?e=3XTsbM>

Thank you for your kind support.

 

Best Regards,
Hagop

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Yogesh,

 

I hope this message finds you well. 

 

With reference to the liability insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, kindly note that incident occurred on 03/12/2024 at the Jacquemus boutique, Dubai Mall. Below, please find the key details and accompanying documentation:

 

Incident Description:

 

*	On 03/12/2024, our VIP client accidentally struck her Hermes ballet flats (slippers) against a damaged corner of the boutique’s fitting room. The affected area had exposed steel protrusions, which constituted an unsafe condition.
*	As a result, the ballet flats were damaged, and the client is requesting reimbursement.

 

Client Details and Purchase History:

*	On 03/12/2024, our VIP client accidentally struck her Hermes ballet flats (slippers) against a damaged corner of the boutique’s fitting room. The affected area had exposed steel protrusions, which constituted an unsafe condition.
*	As a result, the ballet flats were damaged, and the client is requesting reimbursement.

 

Client Details and Purchase History:

 

*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

 

*	Store Manager’s View: The store manager initially indicated that the damage appeared more related to customer-driven actions; however, store personnel later acknowledged there was exposed steel in the fitting room corner, which the client alleges caused the damage.
*	Safety Concern: The incident is without a doubt attributed to a hazardous condition in the fitting room, namely a protruding metal edge. (seen next to the damaged Hermes slipper in the attached photo)
*	The Group Security Control Room (GSCR) has provided CCTV footage of the incident. You may access it by following this link:   Footage <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/miSuCrMz4Tw0lmBUjtWS4iWd2?domain=mctfze-my.sharepoint.com> 
*	Reimbursement Request: The client seeks reimbursement in cash for their damaged Hermes ballet flats, priced at AED 3,900, to purchase a replacement pair.
*	Supporting Attachments:

*	Reimbursement Request: The client seeks reimbursement in cash for their damaged Hermes ballet flats, priced at AED 3,900, to purchase a replacement pair.

	*	Official invoice of the Hermes ballet flats (AED 3,900).
	*	Photos showing both the fitting room’s damaged edge (protruding sharp metal edge) and the client’s resulting damaged ballet flats.
	*	Whatsapp conversation with client requesting as cash reimbursement for the damages
	*	CCTV footage of the incident.  Footage <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/miSuCrMz4Tw0lmBUjtWS4iWd2?domain=mctfze-my.sharepoint.com> 

 

Kindly request GIG to review the enclosed documentation and to provide the proposed settlement based on the applicable terms and conditions of the liability insurance policy.

Hi Hani,

 

It is very subtle. You can not see it even from the CCTV footage.

 

The store manager initially thought the damage was due to the negligence of the customer. However, upon close inspection, the metal protrusion was noticed by the other store staff and subsequently reported to the store manager.

 

The placement also being at the bottom of the arc of the fitting room made early detection and discovery more difficult.

 

Trust the above clarifies.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Subject: Insurance Claim Submission – Incident at Jacquemus Boutique (03/12/2024) - Allied Enterprises LLC

 

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Yogesh,

 

I hope this message finds you well. 

 

With reference to the liability insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, kindly note that incident occurred on 03/12/2024 at the Jacquemus boutique, Dubai Mall. Below, please find the key details and accompanying documentation:

 

Incident Description:

 

*	On 03/12/2024, our VIP client accidentally struck her Hermes ballet flats (slippers) against a damaged corner of the boutique’s fitting room. The affected area had exposed steel protrusions, which constituted an unsafe condition.
*	As a result, the ballet flats were damaged, and the client is requesting reimbursement.

 

Client Details and Purchase History:

 

*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

chunks.text:
*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

 

*	Store Manager’s View: The store manager initially indicated that the damage appeared more related to customer-driven actions; however, store personnel later acknowledged there was exposed steel in the fitting room corner, which the client alleges caused the damage.
*	Safety Concern: The incident is without a doubt attributed to a hazardous condition in the fitting room, namely a protruding metal edge. (seen next to the damaged Hermes slipper in the attached photo)
*	The Group Security Control Room (GSCR) has provided CCTV footage of the incident. You may access it by following this link:   Footage <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/KRNeCqMy4TL1jxrtWUDSE6aKJ?domain=mctfze-my.sharepoint.com> 
*	Reimbursement Request: The client seeks reimbursement in cash for their damaged Hermes ballet flats, priced at AED 3,900, to purchase a replacement pair.
*	Supporting Attachments:

	*	Official invoice of the Hermes ballet flats (AED 3,900).
	*	Photos showing both the fitting room’s damaged edge (protruding sharp metal edge) and the client’s resulting damaged ballet flats.
	*	Whatsapp conversation with client requesting as cash reimbursement for the damages
	*	CCTV footage of the incident.  Footage <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/KRNeCqMy4TL1jxrtWUDSE6aKJ?domain=mctfze-my.sharepoint.com>

Kindly request GIG to review the enclosed documentation and to provide the proposed settlement based on the applicable terms and conditions of the liability insurance policy.

 

Thank you for your kind support.

With reference to the liability insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, kindly note that incident occurred on 03/12/2024 at the Jacquemus boutique, Dubai Mall. Below, please find the key details and accompanying documentation:

 

Incident Description:

 

*	On 03/12/2024, our VIP client accidentally struck her Hermes ballet flats (slippers) against a damaged corner of the boutique’s fitting room. The affected area had exposed steel protrusions, which constituted an unsafe condition.
*	As a result, the ballet flats were damaged, and the client is requesting reimbursement.

 

Client Details and Purchase History:

 

*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

 

*	Store Manager’s View: The store manager initially indicated that the damage appeared more related to customer-driven actions; however, store personnel later acknowledged there was exposed steel in the fitting room corner, which the client alleges caused the damage.
*	Safety Concern: The incident is without a doubt attributed to a hazardous condition in the fitting room, namely a protruding metal edge. (seen next to the damaged Hermes slipper in the attached photo)

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Yogesh,

 

I hope this message finds you well. 

 

With reference to the liability insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, kindly note that incident occurred on 03/12/2024 at the Jacquemus boutique, Dubai Mall. Below, please find the key details and accompanying documentation:

 

Incident Description:

 

*	On 03/12/2024, our VIP client accidentally struck her Hermes ballet flats (slippers) against a damaged corner of the boutique’s fitting room. The affected area had exposed steel protrusions, which constituted an unsafe condition.
*	As a result, the ballet flats were damaged, and the client is requesting reimbursement.

 

Client Details and Purchase History:

 

*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

 

*	Store Manager’s View: The store manager initially indicated that the damage appeared more related to customer-driven actions; however, store personnel later acknowledged there was exposed steel in the fitting room corner, which the client alleges caused the damage.
*	Safety Concern: The incident is without a doubt attributed to a hazardous condition in the fitting room, namely a protruding metal edge. (seen next to the damaged Hermes slipper in the attached photo)
*	The Group Security Control Room (GSCR) has provided CCTV footage of the incident. You may access it by following this link:   Footage <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/gwu3CpXx5fQjqmRUBUvSGlTNC?domain=mctfze-my.sharepoint.com> 
*	Reimbursement Request: The client seeks reimbursement in cash for their damaged Hermes ballet flats, priced at AED 3,900, to purchase a replacement pair.
*	Supporting Attachments:

	*	Official invoice of the Hermes ballet flats (AED 3,900).
	*	Photos showing both the fitting room’s damaged edge (protruding sharp metal edge) and the client’s resulting damaged ballet flats.
	*	Whatsapp conversation with client requesting as cash reimbursement for the damages
	*	CCTV footage of the incident.  Footage <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/gwu3CpXx5fQjqmRUBUvSGlTNC?domain=mctfze-my.sharepoint.com>

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> > 
Sent: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 2:54 AM

Subject: Insurance Claim Submission – Incident at Jacquemus Boutique (03/12/2024) - Allied Enterprises LLC

 

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Yogesh,

 

I hope this message finds you well. 

 

With reference to the liability insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, kindly note that incident occurred on 03/12/2024 at the Jacquemus boutique, Dubai Mall. Below, please find the key details and accompanying documentation:

 

Incident Description:

 

*	On 03/12/2024, our VIP client accidentally struck her Hermes ballet flats (slippers) against a damaged corner of the boutique’s fitting room. The affected area had exposed steel protrusions, which constituted an unsafe condition.
*	As a result, the ballet flats were damaged, and the client is requesting reimbursement.

 

Client Details and Purchase History:

 

*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\C31NMI7 - insurance claim submission – incident at jacquemus boutique (03 12 2024) - allied enterprises llc\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

 

*	Store Manager’s View: The store manager initially indicated that the damage appeared more related to customer-driven actions; however, store personnel later acknowledged there was exposed steel in the fitting room corner, which the client alleges caused the damage.
*	Safety Concern: The incident is without a doubt attributed to a hazardous condition in the fitting room, namely a protruding metal edge. (seen next to the damaged Hermes slipper in the attached photo)
*	The Group Security Control Room (GSCR) has provided CCTV footage of the incident. You may access it by following this link:   Footage <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/TeGsC0XJzfr8B74FBUoT91Q0F?domain=mctfze-my.sharepoint.com> 
*	Reimbursement Request: The client seeks reimbursement in cash for their damaged Hermes ballet flats, priced at AED 3,900, to purchase a replacement pair.
*	Supporting Attachments:

	*	Official invoice of the Hermes ballet flats (AED 3,900).
	*	Photos showing both the fitting room’s damaged edge (protruding sharp metal edge) and the client’s resulting damaged ballet flats.
	*	Whatsapp conversation with client requesting as cash reimbursement for the damages
	*	CCTV footage of the incident.  Footage <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/TeGsC0XJzfr8B74FBUoT91Q0F?domain=mctfze-my.sharepoint.com>

Trust the above clarifies.

Hagop

Dear Yogesh,

 

I hope this message finds you well. 

 

With reference to the liability insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, kindly note that incident occurred on 03/12/2024 at the Jacquemus boutique, Dubai Mall. Below, please find the key details and accompanying documentation:

 

Incident Description:

 

*	On 03/12/2024, our VIP client accidentally struck her Hermes ballet flats (slippers) against a damaged corner of the boutique’s fitting room. The affected area had exposed steel protrusions, which constituted an unsafe condition.
*	As a result, the ballet flats were damaged, and the client is requesting reimbursement.

 

Client Details and Purchase History:

*	On 03/12/2024, our VIP client accidentally struck her Hermes ballet flats (slippers) against a damaged corner of the boutique’s fitting room. The affected area had exposed steel protrusions, which constituted an unsafe condition.
*	As a result, the ballet flats were damaged, and the client is requesting reimbursement.

 

Client Details and Purchase History:

 

*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

 

*	Store Manager’s View: The store manager initially indicated that the damage appeared more related to customer-driven actions; however, store personnel later acknowledged there was exposed steel in the fitting room corner, which the client alleges caused the damage.
*	Safety Concern: The incident is without a doubt attributed to a hazardous condition in the fitting room, namely a protruding metal edge. (seen next to the damaged Hermes slipper in the attached photo)
*	The Group Security Control Room (GSCR) has provided CCTV footage of the incident. You may access it by following this link:   Footage <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/KzdpCyJKgfL64oofvUnUxMu-b?domain=mctfze-my.sharepoint.com> 
*	Reimbursement Request: The client seeks reimbursement in cash for their damaged Hermes ballet flats, priced at AED 3,900, to purchase a replacement pair.
*	Supporting Attachments:

Hi Hani,

 

It is very subtle. You can not see it even from the CCTV footage.

 

The store manager initially thought the damage was due to the negligence of the customer. However, upon close inspection, the metal protrusion was noticed by the other store staff and subsequently reported to the store manager.

 

The placement also being at the bottom of the arc of the fitting room made early detection and discovery more difficult.

 

Trust the above clarifies.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Subject: Insurance Claim Submission – Incident at Jacquemus Boutique (03/12/2024) - Allied Enterprises LLC

 

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Yogesh,

 

I hope this message finds you well. 

 

With reference to the liability insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, kindly note that incident occurred on 03/12/2024 at the Jacquemus boutique, Dubai Mall. Below, please find the key details and accompanying documentation:

 

Incident Description:

 

*	On 03/12/2024, our VIP client accidentally struck her Hermes ballet flats (slippers) against a damaged corner of the boutique’s fitting room. The affected area had exposed steel protrusions, which constituted an unsafe condition.
*	As a result, the ballet flats were damaged, and the client is requesting reimbursement.

 

Client Details and Purchase History:

 

*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

chunks.text:
*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

 

*	Store Manager’s View: The store manager initially indicated that the damage appeared more related to customer-driven actions; however, store personnel later acknowledged there was exposed steel in the fitting room corner, which the client alleges caused the damage.
*	Safety Concern: The incident is without a doubt attributed to a hazardous condition in the fitting room, namely a protruding metal edge. (seen next to the damaged Hermes slipper in the attached photo)
*	The Group Security Control Room (GSCR) has provided CCTV footage of the incident. You may access it by following this link:   Footage <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/rNqoCA90kIlJO18CkUzcGTZOB?domain=mctfze-my.sharepoint.com> 
*	Reimbursement Request: The client seeks reimbursement in cash for their damaged Hermes ballet flats, priced at AED 3,900, to purchase a replacement pair.
*	Supporting Attachments:

	*	Official invoice of the Hermes ballet flats (AED 3,900).
	*	Photos showing both the fitting room’s damaged edge (protruding sharp metal edge) and the client’s resulting damaged ballet flats.
	*	Whatsapp conversation with client requesting as cash reimbursement for the damages
	*	CCTV footage of the incident.  Footage <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/rNqoCA90kIlJO18CkUzcGTZOB?domain=mctfze-my.sharepoint.com>

Kindly request GIG to review the enclosed documentation and to provide the proposed settlement based on the applicable terms and conditions of the liability insurance policy.

 

Thank you for your kind support.

Hagop

Subject: Insurance Claim Submission – Incident at Jacquemus Boutique (03/12/2024) - Allied Enterprises LLC

 

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Yogesh,

 

I hope this message finds you well. 

 

With reference to the liability insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, kindly note that incident occurred on 03/12/2024 at the Jacquemus boutique, Dubai Mall. Below, please find the key details and accompanying documentation:

 

Incident Description:

 

*	On 03/12/2024, our VIP client accidentally struck her Hermes ballet flats (slippers) against a damaged corner of the boutique’s fitting room. The affected area had exposed steel protrusions, which constituted an unsafe condition.
*	As a result, the ballet flats were damaged, and the client is requesting reimbursement.

 

Client Details and Purchase History:

 

*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

chunks.text:
*	The client is a regular VIP customer and had spent approximately AED 15,000 on the day of the incident.
*	The Hermes ballet flats were purchased for AED 3,900

 

Factual Findings and Supporting Details:

 

*	Store Manager’s View: The store manager initially indicated that the damage appeared more related to customer-driven actions; however, store personnel later acknowledged there was exposed steel in the fitting room corner, which the client alleges caused the damage.
*	Safety Concern: The incident is without a doubt attributed to a hazardous condition in the fitting room, namely a protruding metal edge. (seen next to the damaged Hermes slipper in the attached photo)
*	The Group Security Control Room (GSCR) has provided CCTV footage of the incident. You may access it by following this link:   Footage <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/qeOCCGQpqSO9P9otEfpcBkb-C?domain=mctfze-my.sharepoint.com> 
*	Reimbursement Request: The client seeks reimbursement in cash for their damaged Hermes ballet flats, priced at AED 3,900, to purchase a replacement pair.
*	Supporting Attachments:

	*	Official invoice of the Hermes ballet flats (AED 3,900).
	*	Photos showing both the fitting room’s damaged edge (protruding sharp metal edge) and the client’s resulting damaged ballet flats.
	*	Whatsapp conversation with client requesting as cash reimbursement for the damages
	*	CCTV footage of the incident.  Footage <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/qeOCCGQpqSO9P9otEfpcBkb-C?domain=mctfze-my.sharepoint.com>
